greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Numerator of (1/n)*Sum_{k=0..n-1} 1/binomial(n-1,k) for n>0 else 0.
comment: a(n) is also the numerator of (1/2^n)*Sum_{k=1..n} 2^k/k. - _Groux Roland_, Jan 13 2009
link: Seiichi Manyama, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..1000 (terms 0..200 from T. D. Noe)
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Leibniz Harmonic Triangle
formula: a(n) = numerator((-1)^(n-1)/(n-1)!*Sum_{k=0..n-1} 2^k*bernoulli(k)* stirling1(n-1,k)), n>0, a(0)=0. - _Vladimir Kruchinin_, Nov 20 2015
mathematica: a[0] = 0; a[n_] := (1/n) Sum[1/Binomial[n-1, k], {k, 0, n-1}] // Numerator; Table[a[n], {n, 0, 31}] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Sep 28 2016 *)
program: (Maxima) a(n):=if n=0 then 0 else num((-1)^(n-1)/(n-1)!*sum(2^k*bern(k)*(stirling1(n-1,k)),k,0,n-1)); /* _Vladimir Kruchinin_, Nov 20 2015 */
(PARI) vector(40, n, n--; numerator((1/2^n)*sum(k=1, n, 2^k/k))) \\ _Altug Alkan_, Nov 20 2015
xref: See A046825, the main entry for this sequence. Cf. A046879.
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_
